intro: Pentacalia cadiriensis, commonly known as the Cadiriensis pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes numerous species of bellflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
